dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.2.3552

idCitation.resTitle: 2010 Median Household Income by Census Tract

dataIdInfo.idPurp: 2010 Median Household Income in the past 12 months (inflation-adjusted dollars) in Los Angeles County by 2010 Census Tracts.
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Household Income:The sum of the income of all people 15 years and older living in the household. A household includes related family members and all the unrelated people, if any, such as lodgers, foster children, wards, or employees who share the housing unit. A person living alone in a housing unit, or a group of unrelated people sharing a housing unit, is also counted as a household.

Median: The point that divides the household income distribution into halves, one-half with income above the median and the other with income below the median. The median is based on the income distribution of all households, including those with no income.

2010 Census Tract: There are 3 different versionsof 2010 Census Tract Boundary with slight change. This data is based on the 1st version of 2010 Census Tract. For further information, please refer to the file locatedat the eGIS Member Network Shared Drive Demography folder:

'\Demography\Notice on Census Tract Update in 2012\Notice1 Census Tract Update in 2012.docx'

Five-Year estimate:The ACS produces period estimate of socioeconomic characteristics. It is designed to provide estimates describing the average characteristics of an area over a specific time period. In the case of 2010 and 2011 ACS 5-YR estimate, the period covers January 2006 through December 2010 and January 2007 through December 2011, respectively..

For further information, refer to the ACS handbook http://census.gov/content/dam/Census/library/publications/2008/acs/ACSGeneralHandbook.pdf
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Census Bureau's Population Estimates Program that produces and disseminates the official estimates of the population for the nation, states, counties, cities and towns and estimates of housing units for states and counties.
